fields.summary: euca-bundle-instance needs example for registering the bundled instance

fields.description: In Eucalyptus 3.1 Administration guide description of euca-bundle-instance command is incomplete. A necessery step after euca-bundle-instance is euca-register which is not mentioned in the Admin. guide. The syntax for the euca-register step is not straightforward and should be added.
fields.summary: In Eucalyptus 3.1 Administration guide the explanation for euca-bundle-instance command is insufficient

comments.body:
The euca-register step is still missing from admin guide!

Example:
euca-bundle-instance i-01F944AC -b bucket -p windows_7  -o $EC2_ACCESS_KEY -w $EC2_SECRET_KEY

euca-register bucket/windows_7.manifest.xml
Added link to existing upload/register topic.

The issue is not fixed in the new admin guide. The following step is still missing.

euca-register bucket/windows_7.manifest.xml

The registration step is still missing from new admin guide.
-> On page 87:

It has to be explained that euca-bundle-instance bundles and uploads.

Example:
euca-bundle-instance i-01F944AC -b bucket -p windows_7 -o
$EC2_ACCESS_KEY -w $EC2_SECRET_KEY

And the very non-straightforward registering step is still missing
from the admin guide:

euca-register bucket/windows_7.manifest.xml
Scott, let us know if you can get this into the 3.2 docs.

Scott,

The upload and register steps for euca-bundle-image do NOT work for
euca-bundle-instance.

euca-bundle-instance is different. It bundles and uploads.
It does not output the manifest file. Without knowing the right
 syntax the user will not be able to register the image.

You have to add the one line register step as I wrote it in the example.
Directing user to euca-bundle-image is confusing.

Alice



On Wed, Nov 28, 2012 at 11:40 AM, Scott Butler (JIRA)

Thanks for clarifying. I will fix.

Sent from my iPhone
Added proper example. Thanks for your patience!
Scott, Lester, should Doc-552 be resolved now with Scott changes?  Or do we need to pull in Lester's changes as well?
I think it should be resolved, but will defer to Lester on that.

Both fixes are the same, so lets take whichever you want.  If you merge the commit in https://github.com/eucalyptus/documentation/pull/50 it makes sense to close this and resolve DOC-552 I think.  Otherwise don't merge it, close 552 and mark this one was resolved if we take Scott's.  Probably not my decision to make since I'm not Department of Documentation :D
Let's use mine…only because it means I don't have to mess around with remembering the mechanics of merging commits from github.  :)
Sounds good!  Let me comment on the other ticket and the pull request.
Closing out old resolved bug.  Feel free to re-open if this is still an issue.
